alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 12 at 3:21AM EST until January 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...During the High Wind Warning, expect southeast to south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 60 mph or higher for locations above 2500 feet elevation and immediately downwind of Pine and Black Mountains, and expect southeast to south winds of 15 to 20 mph with gusts of 35 to 50 mph elsewhere. During the Wind Advisory, expect southwest winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Harlan and Letcher Counties. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 7 AM this morning to 5 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest and most frequent wind gusts are generally expected during two time frames. The first is from this morning into the afternoon, especially for ridgetops and areas of more open terrain as well as locations immediately downwind of Black and Pine Mountains. The second timeframe is from late this evening into the overnight.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
